name: Healthy Spinach, Beetroot, and Tomato Soup
instructions: In a cooker, take 1 tsp of Butter and 1 tsp of Ginger-Garlic paste.
Add the veggies: 500 gm of Fresh Green Spinach, 2 Beetroots (peeled and roughly chopped), and ½ kg of Tomatoes (chopped).
Next, add 2 tsp of Salt and 2 cups of Water.
Put the veggies to boil for 2 whistles.

Once boiled, separate the veggies and their stock by taking out the veggies in a strainer. Separate the stock at this stage so that the veggies blend easily in the blender without too much liquid. Do not throw away the stock; it will be added back later.
Let the veggies cool down before putting them into the blender.
Blend the veggies.
Run the blended puree through a strainer to get a perfectly smooth textured soup.
Transfer the soup to a pan.
Add ½ tsp of Sugar (optional) and ½ tsp of Black Pepper Powder.
Let the soup simmer for 2 minutes on low flame.
Pour the soup into a soup bowl.
Garnish with roasted pumpkin seeds, roasted sesame seeds, and chopped cashews.
Serve and enjoy a bowl of pure comfort.

name: Garlic Bread
ingredients: 1 long thin loaf of bread (e.g., baguette) or any bread variety
instructions: Take a long thin loaf of bread called the baguette (or any bread variety) and cut the loaf into 1-inch slices.
To make the garlic butter, take 3 tbsp of softened salted butter, add 1 tbsp of chopped green coriander, and 1 tbsp of minced garlic.
Mix the ingredients to make an easy peasy garlic butter.
Smear the garlic butter on both sides of the bread slices.
On a hot skillet, toast all the slices until they are crisp and slightly brown.
Serve the hot and crispy garlic bread alongside the soup for a perfect pairing.
